meanings.definition: Corresponding in size or amount to something else
meanings.sent1: The small cup was proportionable to the tiny saucer.
meanings.sent2: It is important to have proportionable ingredients when baking a cake.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's ears were so big that they were almost proportionable to its body.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was proportionable to the vastness of her heart.
meanings.sent5: The tree's shadow was proportionable to the angle of the sun.

meanings.definition: Capable of being adjusted or regulated in relation to something else
meanings.sent1: The adjustable chair was proportionable to people of different heights.
meanings.sent2: The thermostat in the house was set to a proportionable temperature.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum cleaner was so efficient that its speed was proportionable to the amount of dirt on the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule was proportionable, allowing her to balance work and leisure time effectively.
meanings.sent5: The car's speed was proportionable to the pressure on the gas pedal.
